1.verse: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the Son of David, the Son of Abraham.

2.verse: Abraham begot Isaac, and Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot Judah and his brethren.

3.verse: And Judah begot Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez begot Hezron, and Hezron begot Aram,

4.verse: and Aram begot Aminadab, and Aminadab begot Nahshon, and Nahshon begot Salmon,

5.verse: and Salmon begot Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz begot Obed by Ruth, and Obed begot Jesse,

6.verse: and Jesse begot David the king. And David the king begot Solomon by her that had been the wife of Uriah,

7.verse: and Solomon begot Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begot Abijah, and Abijah begot Asa,

8.verse: and Asa begot Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat begot Joram, and Joram begot Uzziah,

9.verse: and Uzziah begot Jotham, and Jotham begot Ahaz, and Ahaz begot Hezekiah,

10.verse: and Hezekiah begot Manasseh, and Manasseh begot Amon, and Amon begot Josiah,

11.verse: and Josiah begot Jechonias and his brethren, about the time they were carried away to Babylon.

12.verse: And after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begot Salathiel, and Salathiel begot Zerubbabel,

13.verse: and Zerubbabel begot Abiud, and Abiud begot Eliakim, and Eliakim begot Azor,

14.verse: and Azor begot Zadok, and Zadok begot Achim, and Achim begot Eliud,

15.verse: and Eliud begot Eleazar, and Eleazar begot Matthan, and Matthan begot Jacob,

16.verse: and Jacob begot Joseph, the husband of Mary of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

17.verse: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations, and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations, and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations.

18.verse: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was in this way: When His mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.

19.verse: And Joseph her husband, being a just man and not willing to make her a public example, was minded to put her away privily.

20.verse: But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, "Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.

21.verse: And she shall bring forth a Son, and thou shalt call His name JESUS, for He shall save His people from their sins."

22.verse: Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,

23.verse: "Behold, a virgin shall be with child and shall bring forth a Son, and they shall call His name Emmanuel" (which being interpreted is, "God with us").

24.verse: Then Joseph, being raised from sleep, did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife,

25.verse: and knew her not until she had brought forth her firstborn Son. And he called His name JESUS.

1.verse: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the East to Jerusalem,

2.verse: saying, "Where is He that is born King of the Jews? For we have seen His star in the East and have come to worship Him."

3.verse: When Herod the king had heard these things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

4.verse: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.

5.verse: And they said unto him, "In Bethlehem of Judea, for thus it is written by the prophet:

6.verse: `And thou, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, art not the least among the princes of Judah; for out of thee shall come a Governor, that shall rule My people Israel.'"

7.verse: Then Herod, when he had privily called the wise men, inquired of them diligently what time the star appeared.

8.verse: And he sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and search diligently for the young child, and when ye have found him, bring me word again, that I may come and worship him also."

9.verse: When they had heard the king, they departed; and lo, the star which they saw in the East went before them until it came and stood over where the young Child was.

10.verse: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

11.verse: And when they had come into the house, they saw the young Child with Mary His mother, and fell down and worshiped Him. And when they had opened their treasures, they presented unto Him gifts: gold and frankincense and myrrh.

12.verse: And being warned by God in a dream that they should not return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way.

13.verse: And when they had departed, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, "Arise, and take the young Child and His mother, and flee into Egypt, and be thou there until I bring thee word; for Herod will seek the young Child to destroy Him."

14.verse: When he arose, he took the young Child and His mother by night and departed into Egypt,

15.verse: and was there until the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying, "Out of Egypt have I called My Son."

16.verse: Then Herod, when he saw that he was mocked by the wise men, was exceeding wroth, and sent forth and slew all the children who were in Bethlehem and in all the region thereof, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men.

17.verse: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying,

18.verse: "In Ramah was there a voice heard, lamentation and weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children and would not be comforted, because they are no more."

19.verse: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

20.verse: saying, "Arise, and take the young Child and His mother, and go into the land of Israel, for they are dead who sought the young Child's life."

21.verse: And he arose and took the young Child and His mother, and came into the land of Israel.

22.verse: But when he heard that Archelaus reigned in Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go thither. Notwithstanding, being warned by God in a dream, he turned aside into the region of Galilee.

23.verse: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets: "He shall be called a Nazarene."

1.verse: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judea

2.verse: and saying, "Repent ye, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand."

3.verse: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Isaiah, saying, "The voice of one crying in the wilderness: `Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make His paths straight.'"

4.verse: And the same John had his raiment of camel's hair, and a leather girdle about his loins; and his meat was locusts and wild honey.

5.verse: Then there went out to him Jerusalem and all Judea and all the region round about the Jordan.

6.verse: And they were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.

7.verse: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said unto them, "O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

8.verse: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance,

9.verse: and think not to say to yourselves, `We have Abraham as our father.' For I say unto you that God is able from these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.

10.verse: And now also the ax is laid unto the root of the trees; therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire.

11.verse: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance, but He that cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to bear. He shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire.

12.verse: His fan is in His hand, and He will thoroughly purge His threshing floor and gather His wheat into the garner; but He will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire."

13.verse: Then came Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan unto John to be baptized by him.

14.verse: But John forbad Him, saying, "I have need to be baptized by Thee, and comest Thou to me?"

15.verse: And Jesus answering said unto him, "Suffer it to be so now, for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness." Then John suffered Him.

16.verse: And Jesus, when He had been baptized, went up straightway out of the water. And lo, the heavens were opened unto Him, and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and lighting upon Him.

17.verse: And lo, a voice came from Heaven, saying, "THIS IS MY BELOVED SON, IN WHOM I AM WELL PLEASED."

1.verse: Then was Jesus led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

2.verse: And when He had fasted forty days and forty nights, He afterward hungered.

3.verse: And when the tempter came to Him, he said, "If Thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread."

4.verse: But He answered and said, "It is written: `Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.'"

5.verse: Then the devil took Him up into the holy city, and set Him on a pinnacle of the temple, and

6.verse: said unto Him, "If Thou be the Son of God, cast Thyself down. For it is written: `He shall give His angels charge concerning thee; and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.'"

7.verse: Jesus said unto him, "It is written again: `Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.'"

8.verse: Again, the devil took Him up onto an exceeding high mountain, and showed Him all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them,

9.verse: and said unto Him, "All these things will I give Thee if Thou wilt fall down and worship me."

10.verse: Then said Jesus unto him, "Get thee hence, Satan! For it is written: `Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve.'"

11.verse: Then the devil left Him, and behold, angels came and ministered unto Him.

12.verse: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, He departed into Galilee.

13.verse: And leaving Nazareth, He came and dwelt in Capernaum, which is upon the seacoast in the regions of Zebulun and Naphtali,

14.verse: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

15.verse: "The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, by the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles:

16.verse: the people who sat in darkness saw a great Light; and to them that sat in the region and shadow of death, Light has sprung up."

17.verse: From that time Jesus began to preach and to say, "Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand."

18.verse: And Jesus, walking by the Sea of Galilee, saw two brethren, Simon called Peter and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishers.

19.verse: And He said unto them, "Follow Me, and I will make you fishers of men."

20.verse: And they straightway left their nets and followed Him.

21.verse: And going on from thence He saw two other brethren, James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, in a boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. And He called them,

22.verse: and they immediately left the boat and their father, and followed Him.

23.verse: And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the Gospel of the Kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.

24.verse: And His fame went throughout all Syria. And they brought unto Him all sick people who were taken with divers diseases and torments, and those who were possessed with devils, and those who were lunatic, and those who had the palsy; and He healed them.

25.verse: And there followed Him great multitudes of people from Galilee and from Decapolis, and from Jerusalem and from Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.

1.verse: And seeing the multitudes, He went up onto a mountain; and when He was set, His disciples came unto Him.

2.verse: And He opened His mouth and taught them, saying,

3.verse: "Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

4.verse: Blessed are they that mourn, for they shall be comforted.

5.verse: Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

6.verse: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled.

7.verse: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

8.verse: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

9.verse: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called the children of God.

10.verse: Blessed are they that are persecuted for righteousness' sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

11.verse: Blessed are ye when men shall revile you and persecute you, and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely for My sake.

12.verse: Rejoice and be exceeding glad, for great is your reward in Heaven; for so persecuted they the prophets who were before you.

13.verse: "Ye are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost his savor, wherewith shall it be salted? It is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot of men.

14.verse: "Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on a hill cannot be hid.

15.verse: Neither do men light a candle and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick, and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.

16.verse: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in Heaven.

17.verse: "Think not that I am come to destroy the Law or the Prophets. I am not come to destroy, but to fulfill.

18.verse: For verily I say unto you, till heaven and earth pass away, not one jot or one tittle shall in any wise pass from the law till all be fulfilled.

19.verse: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments and shall teach men so, he shall be called the least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whosoever shall do and teach them, the same shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.

20.verse: For I say unto you that unless your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no case enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

21.verse: "Ye have heard that it was said by them of old, `Thou shalt not kill,' and `Whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment.'

22.verse: But I say unto you, that whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment; and whosoever shall say to his brother, `Raca,' shall be in danger of the council; but whosoever shall say, `Thou fool,' shall be in danger of hell fire.

23.verse: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar and there rememberest that thy brother hath aught against thee,

24.verse: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go thy way. First be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift.

25.verse: "Agree with thine adversary quickly while thou art on the way with him, lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison.

26.verse: Verily I say unto thee, thou shalt by no means come out thence until thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

27.verse: "Ye have heard that it was said by them of old, `Thou shalt not commit adultery.'

28.verse: But I say unto you, that whosoever looketh on a woman to lust after her hath committed adultery with her already in his heart.

29.verse: And if thy right eye cause thee to fall, pluck it out and cast it from thee; for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

30.verse: And if thy right hand cause thee to fall, cut it off and cast it from thee; for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish, and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell.

31.verse: "It hath been said, `Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement.'

32.verse: But I say unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, except for the cause of fornication, causeth her to commit adultery; and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery.

33.verse: "Again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old times, `Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths.'

34.verse: But I say unto you, swear not at all: neither by Heaven, for it is God's throne;

35.verse: nor by the earth, for it is His footstool; neither by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

36.verse: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

37.verse: But let your communication be `yea, yea' or `nay, nay'; for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

38.verse: "Ye have heard that it hath been said, `An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.'

39.verse: But I say unto you that ye resist not evil, but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek, turn to him the other also.

40.verse: And if any man will sue thee at the law and take away thy coat, let him have thy cloak also.

41.verse: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him two.

42.verse: Give to him that asketh thee; and from him that would borrow of thee, turn not thou away.

43.verse: "Ye have heard that it hath been said, `Thou shalt love thy neighbor and hate thine enemy.'

44.verse: But I say unto you, love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them that despitefully use you and persecute you,

45.verse: that ye may be the children of your Father who is in Heaven. For He maketh His sun to rise on the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

46.verse: For if ye love them that love you, what reward have ye? Do not even the publicans the same?

47.verse: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye more than others? Do not even the publicans so?

48.verse: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father who is in Heaven is perfect.

1.verse: "Take heed that ye do not your almsgiving before men, to be seen by them; otherwise ye have no reward from your Father who is in Heaven.

2.verse: Therefore when thou givest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.

3.verse: But when thou givest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth,

4.verse: that thine almsgiving may be in secret; and thy Father who seeth in secret, Himself shall reward thee openly.

5.verse: "And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are. For they love to pray standing in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.

6.verse: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

7.verse: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions as the heathen do, for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

8.verse: Be not ye therefore like unto them, for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of before ye ask Him.

9.verse: In this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father who art in Heaven, hallowed be Thy name.

10.verse: Thy Kingdom come. Thy will be done on earth, as it is in Heaven.

11.verse: Give us this day our daily bread.

12.verse: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

13.verse: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For Thine is the Kingdom, and the power and the glory for ever. Amen.

14.verse: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

15.verse: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

16.verse: "Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance. For they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, they have their reward.

17.verse: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head and wash thy face,

18.verse: that thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father, who seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

19.verse: "Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal;

20.verse: but lay up for yourselves treasures in Heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal.

21.verse: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

22.verse: "The light of the body is the eye. If therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

23.verse: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!

24.verse: "No man can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and love the other, or else he will hold to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

25.verse: "Therefore I say unto you, take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

26.verse: Behold the fowls of the air, for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

27.verse: "Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

28.verse: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They toil not, neither do they spin,

29.verse: and yet I say unto you that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

30.verse: Therefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, shall He not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?

31.verse: Therefore take no thought, saying, `What shall we eat?' or `What shall we drink?' or `Wherewith shall we be clothed?'

32.verse: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek.) For your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

33.verse: But seek ye first the Kingdom of God and His righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you.

34.verse: "Take therefore no thought for the morrow, for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.

1.verse: "Judge not, that ye be not judged.

2.verse: For with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.

3.verse: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

4.verse: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, `Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye,' and behold, a beam is in thine own eye?

5.verse: Thou hypocrite, first cast out the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.

6.verse: "Give not that which is holy unto the dogs, neither cast ye your pearls before swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rend you.

7.verse: "Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

8.verse: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

9.verse: "Or what man is there among you whom, if his son ask for bread, will give him a stone?

10.verse: Or if he ask for a fish, will give him a serpent?

11.verse: If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father who is in Heaven give good things to them that ask Him?

12.verse: Therefore, all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them; for this is the Law and the Prophets.

13.verse: "Enter ye in at the strait gate, for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leadeth to destruction, and many there be who go in thereat.

14.verse: Because strait is the gate, and narrow is the way which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

15.verse: "Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravening wolves.

16.verse: Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

17.verse: Even so, every good tree bringeth forth good fruit, but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

18.verse: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

19.verse: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down and cast into the fire.

20.verse: Therefore, by their fruits ye shall know them.

21.verse: "Not every one that saith unto Me, `Lord, Lord,' shall enter into the Kingdom of Heaven, but he that doeth the will of My Father who is in Heaven.

22.verse: Many will say to Me in that Day, `Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied in Thy name, and in Thy name have cast out devils, and in Thy name done many wonderful works?'

23.verse: And then will I profess unto them, `I never knew you: depart from Me, ye that work iniquity.'

24.verse: "Therefore, whosoever heareth these sayings of Mine and doeth them, I will liken him unto a wise man, who built his house upon a rock.

25.verse: And the rain descended and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house; and it fell not, for it was founded upon a rock.

26.verse: And every one that heareth these sayings of Mine and doeth them not, shall be likened unto a foolish man, who built his house upon the sand;

27.verse: and the rain descended, and the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell, and great was the fall of it."

28.verse: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at His doctrine;

29.verse: for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.

1.verse: When He had come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed Him.

2.verse: And behold, there came a leper and worshiped Him, saying, "Lord, if Thou wilt, Thou canst make me clean."

3.verse: And Jesus put forth His hand and touched him, saying, "I will: be thou clean." And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

4.verse: And Jesus said unto him, "See thou tell no man; but go thy way, show thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded for a testimony unto them."

5.verse: And when Jesus had entered into Capernaum, there came unto Him a centurion, beseeching Him

6.verse: and saying, "Lord, my servant lieth at home sick with the palsy and grievously tormented."

7.verse: And Jesus said unto him, "I will come and heal him."

8.verse: The centurion answered and said, "Lord, I am not worthy that Thou shouldest come under my roof. But speak the word only, and my servant shall be healed.

9.verse: For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to this man, `Go!' and he goeth; and to another, `Come!' and he cometh; and to my servant, `Do this!' and he doeth it."

10.verse: When Jesus heard it, He marveled and said to those who followed, "Verily I say unto you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.

11.verse: And I say unto you, that many shall come from the east and west, and shall sit down with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven.

12.verse: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth."

13.verse: And Jesus said unto the centurion, "Go thy way, and as thou hast believed, so be it done unto thee." And his servant was healed in that selfsame hour.

14.verse: And when Jesus had come into Peter's house, He saw his wife's mother lying and sick with a fever.

15.verse: And He touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she arose and ministered unto them.

16.verse: When the evening had come, they brought unto Him many who were possessed with devils, and He cast out the spirits with His word and healed all who were sick,

17.verse: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, who said, "He Himself took our infirmities and bore our sicknesses."

18.verse: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about Him, He gave commandment to depart unto the other side.

19.verse: And a certain scribe came and said unto Him, "Master, I will follow Thee whithersoever Thou goest."

20.verse: And Jesus said unto him, "The foxes have holes, and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man hath nowhere to lay His head."

21.verse: And another of His disciples said unto Him, "Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father."

22.verse: But Jesus said unto him, "Follow Me, and let the dead bury their dead."

23.verse: And when He had entered into a boat, His disciples followed Him.

24.verse: And behold, there arose a great tempest on the sea, insomuch that the boat was covered with the waves; but He was asleep.

25.verse: And His disciples came to Him and awoke Him, saying, "Lord, save us! We perish!"

26.verse: And He said unto them, "Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith?" Then He arose and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm.

27.verse: But the men marveled, saying, "What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?"

28.verse: And when He had come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes, there met Him two possessed with devils, coming out of the tombs, exceedingly fierce, so that no man might pass by that way.

29.verse: And behold, they cried out, saying, "What have we to do with Thee, Jesus, Thou Son of God? Art Thou come hither to torment us before the time?"

30.verse: Now there was a good way off from them a herd of many swine feeding.

31.verse: So the devils besought Him, saying, "If Thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine."

32.verse: And He said to them, "Go." And when they had come out, they went into the herd of swine, and behold, the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea and perished in the waters.

33.verse: And those who kept them fled and went their ways into the city, and told everything and what had befallen the ones possessed with the devils.

34.verse: And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus. And when they saw Him, they besought Him that He would depart out of their borders.

1.verse: And He entered into a boat, and passed over and came into His own city.

2.verse: And behold, they brought to Him a man sick with the palsy, lying on a bed. And Jesus, seeing their faith, said unto the one sick with the palsy, "Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee."

3.verse: And behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, "This man blasphemeth."

4.verse: And Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said, "Why think ye evil in your hearts?

5.verse: For which is easier: to say, `Thy sins be forgiven thee,' or to say, `Arise and walk'?

6.verse: But that ye may know that the Son of Man hath power on earth to forgive sins,"-- (then said He to the one sick with palsy) "Arise, take up thy bed and go unto thine house."

7.verse: And he arose and departed to his house.

8.verse: But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such power unto men.

9.verse: And as Jesus passed forth from thence, He saw a man named Matthew, sitting in the customhouse. And He said unto him, "Follow Me." And he arose and followed Him.

10.verse: And it came to pass as Jesus sat at meat in the house, behold, many publicans and sinners came and sat down with Him and His disciples.

11.verse: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto His disciples, "Why eateth your master with publicans and sinners?"

12.verse: But when Jesus heard that, He said unto them, "They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick.

13.verse: But go ye and learn what this meaneth: `I will have mercy and not sacrifice.' For I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."

14.verse: Then the disciples of John came to Him, saying, "Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but Thy disciples fast not?"

15.verse: And Jesus said unto them, "Can the attendants of the bridechamber mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom shall be taken from them, and then shall they fast.

16.verse: "No man putteth a piece of new cloth upon an old garment, for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is made worse.

17.verse: Neither do men put new wine into old wineskins, else the wineskins burst and the wine runneth out and the skins perish. But they put new wine into new wineskins, and both are preserved."

18.verse: While He spoke these things unto them, behold, there came a certain ruler and worshiped Him, saying, "My daughter is even now dead, but come and lay Thy hand upon her, and she shall live."

19.verse: And Jesus arose and followed him, and so did His disciples.

20.verse: And behold, a woman who was diseased with an issue of blood for twelve years came up behind Him and touched the hem of His garment;

21.verse: for she said to herself, "If I may but touch His garment, I shall be whole."

22.verse: But Jesus turned about, and when He saw her, He said, "Daughter, be of good comfort; thy faith hath made thee whole." And the woman was made whole from that hour.

23.verse: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise,

24.verse: He said unto them, "Give way, for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth." And they laughed Him to scorn.

25.verse: But when the people were put outside, He went in and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.

26.verse: And the fame thereof went abroad throughout all the land.

27.verse: And when Jesus departed thence, two blind men followed Him, crying and saying, "Thou Son of David, have mercy on us!"

28.verse: And when He had come into the house, the blind men came to Him, and Jesus said unto them, "Believe ye that I am able to do this?" They said unto Him, "Yea, Lord."

29.verse: Then He touched their eyes, saying, "According to your faith, be it unto you."

30.verse: And their eyes were opened, and Jesus strictly charged them, saying, "See that no man know it."

31.verse: But they, when they had departed, spread abroad His fame in all that country.

32.verse: As they went out, behold, they brought to Him a man, dumb and possessed with a devil.

33.verse: And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spoke; and the multitudes marveled, saying, "It was never so seen in Israel."

34.verse: But the Pharisees said, "He casteth out the devils through the prince of the devils."

35.verse: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and preaching the Gospel of the Kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.

36.verse: But when He saw the multitudes, He was moved with compassion for them, because they were faint and were scattered abroad, as sheep having no shepherd.

37.verse: Then said He unto His disciples, "The harvest truly is plenteous, but the laborers are few.

38.verse: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that He will send forth laborers into His harvest."

1.verse: And when He had called unto Him His twelve disciples, He gave them power against unclean spirits to cast them out, and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease.

2.verse: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: the first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;

3.verse: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the publican; James the son of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

4.verse: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.

5.verse: These twelve Jesus sent forth and commanded them, saying, "Go not into the way of the Gentiles, and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not.

6.verse: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

7.verse: And as ye go, preach, saying, `The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.'

8.verse: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, raise the dead, cast out devils. Freely ye have received; freely give.

9.verse: Provide neither gold nor silver nor brass in your purses,

10.verse: nor pack for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet staves; for the workman is worthy of his meat.

11.verse: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter, inquire who in it is worthy, and there abide till ye go thence.

12.verse: And when ye come into a house, salute it,

13.verse: and if the house be worthy, let your peace come upon it; but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you.

14.verse: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, when ye depart out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet.

15.verse: Verily I say unto you, it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the Day of Judgment than for that city.

16.verse: "Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves. Be ye therefore wise as serpents and harmless as doves.

17.verse: But beware of men, for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues,

18.verse: and ye shall be brought before governors and kings for My sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles.

19.verse: But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak, for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak.

20.verse: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaketh in you.

21.verse: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death, and the father the child; and the children shall rise up against their parents and cause them to be put to death.

22.verse: And ye shall be hated by all men for My name's sake, but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.

23.verse: But when they persecute you in this city, flee ye into another; for verily I say unto you, ye shall not have gone through the cities of Israel till the Son of Man be come.

24.verse: "The disciple is not above his master, nor the servant above his lord.

25.verse: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his household!

26.verse: Fear them not therefore, for there is nothing covered that shall not be revealed, and hid that shall not be known.

27.verse: What I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in light; and what ye hear in the ear, that preach ye upon the housetops.

28.verse: And fear not them that kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul; but rather fear Him that is able to destroy both soul and body in hell.

29.verse: "Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? And one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father.

30.verse: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

31.verse: Fear ye not, therefore; ye are of more value than many sparrows.

32.verse: "Whosoever therefore shall confess Me before men, him will I confess also before My Father who is in Heaven.

33.verse: But whosoever shall deny Me before men, him will I also deny before My Father who is in Heaven.

34.verse: "Think not that I am come to send peace on earth. I came not to send peace, but a sword.

35.verse: For I am come to `set a man at variance against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.'

36.verse: And `a man's foes shall be they of his own household.'

37.verse: He that loveth father or mother more than Me, is not worthy of Me. And he that loveth son or daughter more than Me, is not worthy of Me.

38.verse: And he that taketh not his cross and followeth after Me, is not worthy of Me.

39.verse: He that findeth his life, shall lose it; and he that loseth his life for My sake, shall find it.

40.verse: "He that receiveth you, receiveth Me; and he that receiveth Me, receiveth Him that sent Me.

41.verse: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet, shall receive a prophet's reward. And he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man, shall receive a righteous man's reward.

42.verse: And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward."

1.verse: And it came to pass when Jesus had finished commanding His twelve disciples, He departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.

2.verse: Now when John had heard in prison of the works of Christ, he sent two of his disciples,

3.verse: and they said unto Him, "Art thou He that should come, or do we look for another?"

4.verse: Jesus answered and said unto them, "Go and show John again those things which ye hear and see:

5.verse: the blind receive their sight and the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed and the deaf hear, the dead are raised up and the poor have the Gospel preached to them.

6.verse: And blessed is he whosoever shall not be offended in Me."

7.verse: And as they departed, Jesus began to say unto the multitudes concerning John, "What went ye out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken with the wind?

8.verse: But what went ye out to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they that wear soft clothing are in kings' houses.

9.verse: But what went ye out to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.

10.verse: For this is he of whom it is written: `Behold, I send My messenger before Thy face, who shall prepare Thy way before Thee.'

11.verse: Verily I say unto you, among them that are born of women, there hath not risen a greater than John the Baptist; notwithstanding, he that is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

12.verse: And from the days of John the Baptist until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.

13.verse: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John.

14.verse: And if ye will receive it, this is Elijah, who was to come.

15.verse: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

16.verse: "But to what shall I liken this generation? It is like unto children sitting in the markets and calling unto their fellows,

17.verse: and saying, `We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.'

18.verse: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, `He hath a devil!'

19.verse: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, `Behold a gluttonous man and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!' But wisdom is justified by her children."

20.verse: Then He began to upbraid the cities wherein most of His mighty works were done, because they repented not.

21.verse: "Woe unto thee, Chorazin! Woe unto thee, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

22.verse: But I say unto you, it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the Day of Judgment than for you.

23.verse: And thou, Capernaum, which art exalted unto heaven, shalt be brought down to hell; for if the mighty works which have been done in thee had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.

24.verse: But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the Day of Judgment than for thee."

25.verse: At that time Jesus answered and said, "I thank Thee, O Father, Lord of Heaven and earth, because Thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes.

26.verse: Even so, Father, for so it seemed good in Thy sight.

27.verse: "All things are delivered unto Me by My Father, and no man knoweth the Son, but the Father; neither knoweth any man the Father, save the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal Him.

28.verse: "Come unto Me all ye that labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

29.verse: Take My yoke upon you and learn of Me, for I am meek and lowly in heart, and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

30.verse: For My yoke is easy, and My burden is light."

1.verse: At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the corn; and His disciples were hungry and began to pluck the ears of corn and to eat.

2.verse: But when the Pharisees saw it, they said unto Him, "Behold, thy disciples do that which is not lawful to do upon the Sabbath day."

3.verse: But He said unto them, "Have ye not read what David did when he hungered and they that were with him:

4.verse: how he entered into the house of God and ate the showbread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

5.verse: Or have ye not read in the law how on the Sabbath days the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath and are blameless?

6.verse: But I say unto you, that in this place is One greater than the temple.

7.verse: But if ye had known what this meaneth, `I will have mercy and not sacrifice,' ye would not have condemned the guiltless.

8.verse: For the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath day."

9.verse: And when He had departed thence, He went into their synagogue.

10.verse: And behold, there was a man who had his hand withered. And they asked Him, saying, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath days?" -- that they might accuse Him.

11.verse: And He said unto them, "What man shall there be among you that shall have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the Sabbath day, will not lay hold on it and lift it out?

12.verse: How much then is a man better than a sheep? Therefore it is lawful to do well on the Sabbath days."

13.verse: Then He said to the man, "Stretch forth thine hand." And he stretched it forth, and it was restored whole like the other.

14.verse: Then the Pharisees went out and held a council against Him, how they might destroy Him.

15.verse: But when Jesus knew of it, He withdrew Himself from thence. And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them all.

16.verse: And He charged them that they should not make Him known,

17.verse: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

18.verse: "Behold My Servant whom I have chosen, My Beloved in whom My soul is well pleased: I will put My Spirit upon Him, and He shall show judgment to the Gentiles.

19.verse: He shall not strive nor cry, neither shall any man hear His voice in the streets.

20.verse: A bruised reed shall He not break, and smoking flax shall He not quench till He send forth judgment unto victory;

21.verse: and in His name shall the Gentiles trust."

22.verse: Then was brought unto Him one possessed with a devil, blind and dumb; and He healed him, so that the blind and dumb both spoke and saw.

23.verse: And all the people were amazed and said, "Is not this the Son of David?"

24.verse: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, "This fellow doth not cast out devils, except by Beelzebub, the prince of devils."

25.verse: And Jesus knew their thoughts and said unto them, "Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself shall not stand.

26.verse: And if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how then shall his kingdom stand?

27.verse: And if I by Beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they shall be your judges.

28.verse: But if I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the Kingdom of God is come unto you.

29.verse: Or else how can one enter into a strong man's house and despoil his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? And then he will despoil his house.

30.verse: "He that is not with Me is against Me, and he that gathereth not with Me scattereth abroad.

31.verse: Therefore I say unto you, all manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men, but the blasphemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men.

32.verse: And whosoever speaketh a word against the Son of Man, it shall be forgiven him; but whosoever speaketh against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this world, neither in the world to come.

33.verse: Either make the tree good and his fruit good, or else make the tree corrupt and his fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by his fruit.

34.verse: "O generation of vipers, how can ye, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh.

35.verse: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart bringeth forth good things; and an evil man out of the evil treasure bringeth forth evil things.

36.verse: But I say unto you that every idle word that men shall speak, they shall give account thereof in the Day of Judgment.

37.verse: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned."

38.verse: Then certain of the scribes and of the Pharisees answered, saying, "Master, we would see a sign from thee."

39.verse: But He answered and said unto them, "An evil and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign, and there shall no sign be given to it, but the sign of the prophet Jonah.

40.verse: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the whale's belly, so shall the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

41.verse: The men of Nineveh shall rise in the Judgment with this generation and shall condemn it, because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, a greater than Jonah is here.

42.verse: The queen of the south shall rise up in the Judgment with this generation and shall condemn it, for she came from the uttermost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, a greater than Solomon is here.

43.verse: "When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest, and findeth none.

44.verse: Then he saith, `I will return into my house from whence I came out.' And when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.

45.verse: Then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they enter in and dwell there; and the last state of that man is worse than the first. Even so shall it be also unto this wicked generation."

46.verse: While He yet talked to the people, behold, His mother and His brethren stood outside, desiring to speak with Him.

47.verse: Then one said unto Him, "Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand outside, desiring to speak with thee."

48.verse: But He answered and said unto him that told Him, "Who is My mother? And who are My brethren?"

49.verse: And He stretched forth His hand toward His disciples and said, "Behold, My mother and My brethren!

50.verse: For whosoever shall do the will of My Father who is in Heaven, the same is My brother, and sister, and mother."

1.verse: The same day, Jesus went out of the house and sat by the seaside.

2.verse: And great multitudes were gathered together unto Him, so that He went into a boat and sat, and the whole multitude stood on the shore.

3.verse: And He spoke many things unto them in parables, saying, "Behold, a sower went forth to sow.

4.verse: And when he sowed, some seeds fell by the wayside; and the fowls came and devoured them up.

5.verse: Some fell upon stony places where they had not much earth; and forthwith they sprang up, because they had no deepness of earth.

6.verse: And when the sun was up they were scorched, and because they had no root they withered away.

7.verse: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up and choked them.

8.verse: But others fell into good ground and brought forth fruit, some a hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

9.verse: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear."

10.verse: And the disciples came and said unto Him, "Why speakest Thou unto them in parables?"

11.verse: He answered and said unto them, "Because it is given unto you to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but to them it is not given.

12.verse: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance. But whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he hath.

13.verse: Therefore speak I to them in parables, because seeing, they see not, and hearing, they hear not, neither do they understand.

14.verse: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah, which saith, `By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive.

15.verse: For this people's heart has waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes they have closed; lest at any time they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and should understand with their heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.'

16.verse: But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.

17.verse: For verily I say unto you, that many prophets and righteous men have desired to see those things which ye see, and have not seen them, and to hear those things which ye hear, and have not heard them.

18.verse: "Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower:

19.verse: When any one heareth the Word of the Kingdom and understandeth it not, then cometh the wicked one and catcheth away that which was sown in his heart. This is he that received seed by the wayside.

20.verse: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the Word and at once with joy receiveth it;

21.verse: yet hath he not root in himself, but endureth for a while. For when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the Word, by and by he loses faith.

22.verse: He also that received the seed among the thorns is he that heareth the Word; and the cares of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the Word, and he becometh unfruitful.

23.verse: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the Word and understandeth it; who also beareth fruit and bringeth forth, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty."

24.verse: Another parable put He forth before them, saying, "The Kingdom of Heaven is likened unto a man who sowed good seed in his field;

25.verse: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

26.verse: But when the blades had sprung up and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.

27.verse: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, `Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? From whence then hath come the tares?'

28.verse: He said unto them, `An enemy hath done this.' The servants said unto him, `Wilt thou then have us go and gather them up?'

29.verse: But he said, `Nay, lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.

30.verse: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, "Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them, but gather the wheat into my barn."'"

31.verse: Another parable put He forth before them, saying, "The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took and sowed in his field,

32.verse: which indeed is the least of all seeds; but when it is grown it is the greatest among herbs and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof."

33.verse: Another parable spoke He unto them: "The Kingdom of Heaven is like unto leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal till the whole was leavened."

34.verse: All these things spoke Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spoke He not unto them,

35.verse: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, "I will open My mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world."

36.verse: Then Jesus sent the multitude away and went into the house, and His disciples came unto Him, saying, "Explain unto us the parable of the tares of the field."

37.verse: He answered and said unto them, "He that soweth the good seed is the Son of Man.

38.verse: The field is the world, the good seed are the children of the Kingdom, but the tares are the children of the wicked one.

39.verse: The enemy that sowed them is the devil, the harvest is the end of the world, and the reapers are the angels.

40.verse: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire, so shall it be at the end of this world.

41.verse: The Son of Man shall send forth His angels, and they shall gather out of His Kingdom all things that offend and them that do iniquity,

42.verse: and shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

43.verse: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

44.verse: "Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field, which, when a man hath found, he hideth; and for the joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

45.verse: "Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls,

46.verse: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had and bought it.

47.verse: "Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a net that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind,

48.verse: which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.

49.verse: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth and sever the wicked from among the just,

50.verse: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth."

51.verse: Jesus said unto them, "Have ye understood all these things?" They said unto Him, "Yea, Lord."

52.verse: Then said He unto them, "Therefore every scribe who is instructed unto the Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a man that is a householder, who bringeth forth out of his treasure things new and old."

53.verse: And it came to pass that when Jesus had finished these parables, He departed thence.

54.verse: And when He had come into His own country, He taught them in their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished and said, "From whence hath this man this wisdom and these mighty works?

55.verse: Is not this the carpenter's son? Is not his mother called Mary and his brethren James and Joseph, and Simon and Judas?

56.verse: And his sisters, are they not all with us? From whence then hath this man all these things?"

57.verse: And they were offended at Him. But Jesus said unto them, "A prophet is not without honor, save in his own country and in his own house."

58.verse: And He did not many mighty works there, because of their unbelief.

1.verse: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus

2.verse: and said unto his servants, "This is John the Baptist. He is risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works show forth themselves in him."

3.verse: For Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him and put him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife.

4.verse: For John said unto him, "It is not lawful for thee to have her."

5.verse: And when he would have put him to death, he feared the multitude, because they counted him as a prophet.

6.verse: But when Herod's birthday was kept, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod,

7.verse: whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.

8.verse: And she, being beforehand instructed by her mother, said, "Give me here John the Baptist's head on a charger."

9.verse: And the king was sorry; nevertheless for the oath's sake, and those who sat with him at meat, he commanded it to be given her.

10.verse: And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

11.verse: And his head was brought on a charger and given to the damsel, and she brought it to her mother.

12.verse: And his disciples came, and took up the body and buried it, and went and told Jesus.

13.verse: When Jesus heard of it, He departed thence by boat into a desert place apart. And when the people had heard thereof, they followed Him on foot out of the cities.

14.verse: And Jesus went forth and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and He healed their sick.

15.verse: And when it was evening, His disciples came to Him, saying, "This is a desert place and the time is now past. Send the multitude away, that they may go into the villages and buy themselves victuals."

16.verse: But Jesus said unto them, "They need not depart. Give ye them to eat."

17.verse: And they said unto Him, "We have here but five loaves and two fishes."

18.verse: And He said, "Bring them hither to Me."

19.verse: And He commanded the multitude to sit down on the grass, and took the five loaves and the two fishes; and looking up to Heaven, He blessed and broke the loaves and gave them to His disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

20.verse: And they all ate and were filled. And they took up the fragments that remained, twelve baskets full.

21.verse: And those who had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

22.verse: And straightway Jesus constrained His disciples to get into a boat and to go before Him unto the other side, while He sent the multitudes away.

23.verse: And when He had sent the multitudes away, He went up onto a mountain apart to pray. And when evening had come, He was there alone.

24.verse: But the boat was now in the midst of the sea, tossed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.

25.verse: And in the fourth watch of the night, Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.

26.verse: And when the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying, "It is a spirit"; and they cried out for fear.

27.verse: But straightway Jesus spoke unto them, saying, "Be of good cheer. It is I; be not afraid."

28.verse: And Peter answered Him and said, "Lord, if it be Thou, bid me come unto Thee on the water."

29.verse: And He said, "Come." And when Peter had come down out of the boat, he walked on the water to go to Jesus.

30.verse: But when he saw that the wind was boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, "Lord, save me!"

31.verse: And immediately Jesus stretched forth His hand and caught him and said unto him, "O thou of little faith, why didst thou doubt?"

32.verse: And when they had come into the boat, the wind ceased.

33.verse: Then those who were in the boat came and worshiped Him, saying, "In truth Thou art the Son of God."

34.verse: And when they had gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.

35.verse: And when the men of that place learned of Him, they sent out into all that country round about, and brought unto Him all who were diseased.

36.verse: And they besought Him that they might only touch the hem of His garment. And as many as touched were made perfectly whole.

1.verse: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, who were from Jerusalem, saying,

2.verse: "Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? For they wash not their hands when they eat bread."

3.verse: But He answered and said unto them, "Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?

4.verse: For God commanded, saying, `Honor thy father and mother,' and, `He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.'

5.verse: But ye say that whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, `by whatsoever thou might have profited by me, it is a gift,'

6.verse: and honor not his father or his mother, he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of no effect by your tradition.

7.verse: Ye hypocrites, well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,

8.verse: `This people draweth nigh unto Me with their mouth, and honoreth Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me.

9.verse: But in vain they do worship Me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.'"

10.verse: And He called the multitude and said unto them, "Hear and understand:

11.verse: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man, but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man."

12.verse: Then came His disciples and said unto Him, "Knowest Thou that the Pharisees were offended after they heard this saying?"

13.verse: But He answered and said, "Every plant which My heavenly Father hath not planted shall be rooted up.

14.verse: Let them alone; they are blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch."

15.verse: Then answered Peter and said unto Him, "Explain to us this parable."

16.verse: And Jesus said, "Are ye also yet without understanding?

17.verse: Do ye not yet understand that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the drain?

18.verse: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart, and they defile the man.

19.verse: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:

20.verse: these are the things which defile a man. But to eat with unwashed hands defileth not a man."

21.verse: Then Jesus went thence and departed into the region of Tyre and Sidon.

22.verse: And behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same region and cried unto Him, saying, "Have mercy on me, O Lord, Thou Son of David! My daughter is grievously vexed with a devil."

23.verse: But He answered her not a word. And His disciples came and besought Him, saying, "Send her away, for she crieth after us."

24.verse: But He answered and said, "I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel."

25.verse: Then she came and worshiped Him, saying, "Lord help me."

26.verse: But He answered and said, "It is not meet to take children's bread and cast it to dogs."

27.verse: And she said, "Truth, Lord; yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table."

28.verse: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, "O woman, great is thy faith. Be it unto thee even as thou wilt." And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.

29.verse: And Jesus departed from thence and came nigh unto the Sea of Galilee, and went up onto a mountain and sat down there.

30.verse: And great multitudes came unto Him, having with them those who were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus' feet, and He healed them,

31.verse: insomuch that the multitude wondered when they saw the dumb to speak, and the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see. And they glorified the God of Israel.

32.verse: Then Jesus called His disciples unto Him and said, "I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with Me now three days and have had nothing to eat; and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint on the way."

33.verse: And His disciples said unto Him, "From whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness as to fill so great a multitude?"

34.verse: And Jesus said unto them, "How many loaves have ye?" And they said, "Seven, and a few little fishes."

35.verse: And He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.

36.verse: And He took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and broke them and gave to His disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

37.verse: And they all ate and were filled. And they took up of the broken pieces that were left, seven baskets full.

38.verse: And those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

39.verse: And He sent away the multitude, and took the boat and went into the coasts of Magdala.

1.verse: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and testing, desired Him that He would show them a sign from Heaven.

2.verse: He answered and said unto them, "When it is evening ye say, `It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.'

3.verse: And in the morning, `It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and lowering.' O ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky, but can ye not discern the signs of the times?

4.verse: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign, and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonah." And He left them and departed.

5.verse: And when His disciples had come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.

6.verse: Then Jesus said unto them, "Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees."

7.verse: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "It is because we have taken no bread."

8.verse: But when Jesus perceived this, He said unto them, "O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, `because ye have brought no bread'?

9.verse: Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

10.verse: Nor the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?

11.verse: How is it that ye do not understand that I spoke it not to you concerning bread, but that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees?"

12.verse: Then understood they that He bade them not to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

13.verse: When Jesus came into the region of Caesarea Philippi, He asked His disciples, saying, "Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?"

14.verse: And they said, "Some say that Thou art John the Baptist, some Elijah, and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets." MATT 16:15 He said unto them, "But who say ye that I am?"

15.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

16.verse: And Simon Peter answered and said, "Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God."

17.verse: And Jesus answered and said unto him, "Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-Jonah, for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but My Father who is in Heaven.

18.verse: And I say also unto thee, that thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build My church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.

19.verse: And I will give unto thee the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven. And whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in Heaven, and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in Heaven."

20.verse: Then He charged His disciples that they should tell no man that He was Jesus the Christ.

21.verse: From that time forth began Jesus to show unto His disciples that He must go unto Jerusalem and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.

22.verse: Then Peter took Him and began to rebuke Him, saying, "Be it far from Thee, Lord; this shall not happen unto Thee."

23.verse: But He turned and said unto Peter, "Get thee behind Me, Satan! Thou art an offense unto Me; for thou savorest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men."

24.verse: Then Jesus said unto His disciples, "If any man will come after Me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow Me.

25.verse: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it, and whosoever will lose his life for My sake shall find it.

26.verse: For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world and lose his own soul? Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

27.verse: For the Son of Man shall come in the glory of His Father with His angels, and then He shall reward every man according to his works.

28.verse: Verily I say unto you, there are some standing here who shall not taste of death till they see the Son of Man coming in His Kingdom."

1.verse: And after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John his brother, and brought them up onto a high mountain apart.

2.verse: And He was transfigured before them; and His face shone as the sun, and His raiment was white as the light.

3.verse: And behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elijah, talking with Him.

4.verse: Then answered Peter and said unto Jesus, "Lord, it is good for us to be here. If Thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles: one for Thee and one for Moses and one for Elijah."

5.verse: While he yet spoke, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them. And behold, a voice out of the cloud, said, "THIS IS MY BELOVED SON IN WHOM I AM WELL PLEASED. HEAR YE HIM!"

6.verse: And when the disciples heard it, they fell on their faces and were sore afraid.

7.verse: And Jesus came and touched them and said, "Arise, and be not afraid."

8.verse: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

9.verse: And as they came down from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, "Tell the vision to no man until the Son of Man be risen again from the dead."

10.verse: And His disciples asked Him, saying, "Why then say the scribes that Elijah must first come?"

11.verse: And Jesus answered and said unto them, "Elijah truly shall first come and restore all things.

12.verse: But I say unto you that Elijah is come already, and they knew him not, but have done unto him whatsoever they pleased. Likewise shall also the Son of Man suffer by them."

13.verse: Then the disciples understood that He spoke unto them of John the Baptist.

14.verse: And when they had come to the multitude, there came to Him a certain man, kneeling down to Him and saying,

15.verse: "Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is lunatic and sorely vexed; for ofttimes he falleth into the fire and oft into the water.

16.verse: And I brought him to Thy disciples, and they could not cure him."

17.verse: Then Jesus answered and said, "O faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I suffer you? Bring him hither to Me."

18.verse: And Jesus rebuked the devil, and he departed out of him, and the child was cured from that very hour.

19.verse: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart and said, "Why could we not cast him out?"

20.verse: And Jesus said unto them, "Because of your unbelief; for verily I say unto you, if ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, `Remove hence to yonder place,' and it shall remove. And nothing shall be impossible unto you.

21.verse: However this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting."

22.verse: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them, "The Son of Man shall be betrayed into the hands of men.

23.verse: And they shall kill Him, and the third day He shall be raised again." And they were exceeding sorry.

24.verse: And when they had come to Capernaum, those who collected the tribute money came to Peter and said, "Doth not your master pay tribute?"

25.verse: He said, "Yes." And when he had come into the house, Jesus preceded him, saying, "What thinkest thou, Simon? From whom do the kings of the earth take custom or tribute? From their own children, or from strangers?"

26.verse: Peter said unto Him, "From strangers." Jesus said unto him, "Then are the children free.

27.verse: Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea and cast a hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up. And when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money. That take, and give unto them for Me and thee."

1.verse: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, "Who is the greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven?"

2.verse: And Jesus called a little child unto Him, and set him in the midst of them,

3.verse: and said, "Verily I say unto you, unless ye be converted and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

4.verse: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the Kingdom of Heaven.

5.verse: And whoso shall receive one such little child in My name, receiveth Me.

6.verse: But whoso shall cause one of these little ones who believe in Me to fall, it were better for him that a millstone were hung about his neck, and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea.

7.verse: "Woe unto the world because of offenses! For it must happen that offenses come, but woe to that man by whom the offense cometh.

8.verse: Therefore if thy hand or thy foot cause thee to fall, cut them off and cast them from thee; it is better for thee to enter into life halt or maimed, rather than having two hands or two feet, to be cast into everlasting fire.

9.verse: And if thine eye cause thee to fall, pluck it out and cast it from thee; it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire.

10.verse: "Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones; for I say unto you that in Heaven their angels do always behold the face of My Father who is in Heaven.

11.verse: "For the Son of Man is come to save that which was lost.

12.verse: How think ye? If a man have a hundred sheep and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains and seeketh that which is gone astray?

13.verse: And if it so be that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoiceth more over that sheep than over the ninety and nine which went not astray.

14.verse: Even so it is not the will of your Father who is in Heaven that one of these little ones should perish.

15.verse: "Moreover, if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone. If he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.

16.verse: But if he will not hear thee, then take with thee one or two more, that `in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established.'

17.verse: And if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church; but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as a heathen man and a publican.

18.verse: Verily I say unto you, whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in Heaven; and so whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in Heaven.

19.verse: "Again I say unto you, that if two of you shall agree on earth concerning anything that they shall ask, it shall be done for them by My Father who is in Heaven.

20.verse: For where two or three are gathered together in My name, there am I in the midst of them."

21.verse: Then Peter came to Him and said, "Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? Until seven times?"

22.verse: And Jesus said unto him, "I say not unto thee, until seven times, but until seventy times seven.

23.verse: "Therefore is the Kingdom of Heaven likened unto a certain king who would settle accounts with his servants.

24.verse: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him who owed him ten thousand talents.

25.verse: But inasmuch as he could not pay, his lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife and children and all that he had, and payment to be made.

26.verse: The servant therefore fell down and did homage to him, saying,`Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.'

27.verse: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him and forgave him the debt.

28.verse: But the same servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred pence. And he laid hands on him, and took him by the throat, saying, `Pay me what thou owest.'

29.verse: And his fellow servant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, `Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.'

30.verse: And he would not, but went and cast him into prison till he should pay the debt.

31.verse: So when his fellow servants saw what was done, they were very sorry and came and told unto their lord all that was done.

32.verse: Then his lord, after he had called him, said unto him, `O thou wicked servant, I forgave thee all that debt, because thou desiredst me.

33.verse: Shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellow servant, even as I had pity on thee?'
