34.verse: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors till he should pay all that was due unto him.

35.verse: So likewise shall My heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother's trespasses."

1.verse: And it came to pass that when Jesus had finished these sayings, He departed from Galilee and came into the region of Judea beyond the Jordan.

2.verse: And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them there.

3.verse: The Pharisees also came unto Him, testing Him and saying unto Him, "Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause?"

4.verse: And He answered and said unto them, "Have ye not read, that He that made them at the beginning made them male and female,

5.verse: and said, `For this cause shall a man leave father and mother and shall cleave to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh'?

6.verse: Therefore they are no more two, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder."

7.verse: They said unto Him, "Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement and to put her away?"

8.verse: He said unto them, "Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, suffered you to put away your wives, but from the beginning it was not so.

9.verse: And I say unto you, whosoever shall put away his wife, except it be for fornication, and shall marry another, committeth adultery; and whoso marrieth her who is put away doth commit adultery."

10.verse: His disciples said unto Him, "If the case of the man be so with his wife, it is not good to marry."

11.verse: But He said unto them, "All men cannot receive this saying, save they to whom it is given.

12.verse: For there are some eunuchs who were so born from their mother's womb, and there are some eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men, and there are eunuchs who have made themselves eunuchs for the Kingdom of Heaven's sake. He that is able to receive it, let him receive it."

13.verse: Then were there brought unto Him little children, that He should put His hands on them and pray. And the disciples rebuked them,

14.verse: but Jesus said, "Suffer little children, and forbid them not to come unto Me,for of such is the Kingdom of Heaven."

15.verse: And He laid His hands on them and departed thence.

16.verse: And behold, one came and said unto Him, "Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?"

17.verse: And He said unto him, "Why callest thou Me good? There is none good but One, that is, God. But if thou wilt enter into Life, keep the commandments."

18.verse: He said unto Him, "Which?" Jesus said, "`Thou shalt do no murder; thou shalt not commit adultery; thou shalt not steal; thou shalt not bear false witness;

19.verse: honor thy father and thy mother; and, thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.'"

20.verse: The young man said unto Him, "All these things have I kept from my youth up. What lack I yet?"

21.verse: Jesus said unto him, "If thou wilt be perfect, go and sell what thou hast and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in Heaven; and come and follow Me."

22.verse: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.

23.verse: Then said Jesus unto His disciples, "Verily I say unto you, that a rich man shall hardly enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

24.verse: And again I say unto you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God."

25.verse: When His disciples heard it, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, "Who then can be saved?"

26.verse: But Jesus beheld them and said unto them, "With men this is impossible, but with God all things are possible."

27.verse: Then Peter answered and said unto Him, "Behold, we have forsaken all and followed Thee. What shall we have therefore?"

28.verse: And Jesus said unto them, "Verily I say unto you, that ye that have followed Me, in the regeneration when the Son of Man shall sit on the throne of His glory, ye also shall sit upon twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.

29.verse: And everyone that hath forsaken houses or brethren or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My name's sake, shall receive a hundredfold and shall inherit everlasting life.

30.verse: But many that are first shall be last, and the last shall be first.

1.verse: "For the Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a man that is a householder, who went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard.

2.verse: And when he had agreed with the laborers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

3.verse: And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,

4.verse: and said unto them, `Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you.' And they went their way.

5.verse: Again he went out about the sixth and the ninth hour and did likewise.

6.verse: And about the eleventh hour he went out and found others standing idle, and said unto them, `Why stand ye here all the day idle?'

7.verse: They said unto him, `Because no man hath hired us.' He said unto them, `Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right, that shall ye receive.'

8.verse: So when evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said unto his steward, `Call the laborers and give them their hire, beginning from the last unto the first.'

9.verse: And when they came that were hired about the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.

10.verse: But when the first came, they supposed they should have received more; and they likewise received every man a penny.

11.verse: And when they had received it, they murmured against the master of the house,

12.verse: saying, `These last have wrought but one hour, and thou hast made them equal unto us who have borne the burden and the heat of the day.'

13.verse: But he answered one of them and said, `Friend, I do thee no wrong. Didst thou not agree with me for a penny?

14.verse: Take that which is thine and go thy way. I will give unto this last, even as unto thee.

15.verse: Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with mine own? Is thine eye evil, because I am good?'

16.verse: So the last shall be first, and the first last. For many are called, but few are chosen."

17.verse: And Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the twelve disciples apart on the way and said unto them,

18.verse: "Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of Man shall be betrayed unto the chief priests and unto the scribes, and they shall condemn Him to death,

19.verse: and shall deliver Him to the Gentiles to mock and to scourge and to crucify Him. And the third day, He shall rise again."

20.verse: Then came to Him the mother of Zebedee's children with her sons, worshiping Him and desiring a certain thing of Him.

21.verse: And He said unto her, "What wilt thou?" She said unto Him, "Grant that these my two sons may sit, the one on Thy right hand and the other on the left in Thy Kingdom."

22.verse: But Jesus answered and said, "Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?" They said unto Him, "We are able."

23.verse: And He said unto them, "Ye shall drink indeed of My cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with; but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared by My Father."

24.verse: And when the ten heard it, they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.

25.verse: But Jesus called them unto Him and said, "Ye know that the princes of the Gentiles exercise dominion over them, and they that are great exercise authority upon them.

26.verse: But it shall not be so among you; but whosoever will be great among you, let him be your minister;

27.verse: and whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant,

28.verse: even as the Son of Man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give His life as a ransom for many."

29.verse: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed Him.

30.verse: And behold, two blind men were sitting by the wayside when they heard that Jesus was passing by, and they cried out, saying, "Have mercy on us, O Lord, Thou Son of David!"

31.verse: And the multitude rebuked them, that they should hold their peace; but they cried out the more, saying, "Have mercy on us, O Lord, Thou Son of David!"

32.verse: And Jesus stood still, and called them and said, "What will ye that I shall do unto you?"

33.verse: They said unto Him, "Lord, that our eyes may be opened."

34.verse: So Jesus had compassion on them and touched their eyes, and immediately their eyes received sight, and they followed Him.

1.verse: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem and had come to Bethphage unto the Mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,

2.verse: saying unto them, "Go into the village opposite you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her. Loose them and bring them unto Me.

3.verse: And if any man say aught unto you, ye shall say, `The Lord hath need of them,' and straightway he will send them."

4.verse: All this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

5.verse: "Tell ye the daughter of Zion, `Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek and sitting upon an ass, and a colt, the foal of an ass.'"

6.verse: And the disciples went and did as Jesus commanded them.

7.verse: And they brought the ass and the colt and put on them their clothes, and they set Him thereon.

8.verse: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; and others cut down branches from the trees and strewed them in the way.

9.verse: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried out, saying, "Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is He that cometh in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!"

10.verse: And when He had come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, "Who is this?"

11.verse: And the multitude said, "This is Jesus, the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee."

12.verse: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of those who sold doves,

13.verse: and said unto them, "It is written, `My house shall be called the house of prayer,' but ye have made it a den of thieves."

14.verse: And the blind and the lame came to Him in the temple, and He healed them.

15.verse: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that He did, and the children crying out in the temple and saying, "Hosanna to the Son of David," they were sore displeased,

16.verse: and said unto Him, "Hearest thou what these say?" And Jesus said unto them, "Yea, have ye never read, `Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings Thou hast perfected praise'?"

17.verse: And He left them and went out of the city into Bethany, and He lodged there.

18.verse: Now in the morning as He returned into the city, He hungered.

19.verse: And when He saw a fig tree by the wayside, He came to it and found nothing thereon, but leaves only. And He said unto it, "Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever." And immediately the fig tree withered away.

20.verse: And when the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, "How soon has the fig tree withered away!"

21.verse: Jesus answered and said unto them, "Verily I say unto you, if ye have faith and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, `Be thou removed and be thou cast into the sea,' it shall be done.

22.verse: And all things whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive."

23.verse: And when He had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto Him as He was teaching and said, "By what authority doest thou these things? And who gave thee this authority?"

24.verse: And Jesus answered and said unto them, "I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell Me, I in like manner will tell you by what authority I do these things.

25.verse: The baptism of John: whence was it? From Heaven, or of men?" And they reasoned among themselves, saying, "If we shall say, `From Heaven,' he will say unto us, `Why did ye not then believe him?'

26.verse: But if we shall say, `Of men,' we fear the people, for all hold John to be a prophet."

27.verse: And they answered Jesus and said, "We cannot tell." And He said unto them, "Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

28.verse: "But what think ye? A certain man had two sons. And he came to the first and said, `Son, go work today in my vineyard.'

29.verse: He answered and said, `I will not,' but afterward he repented and went.

30.verse: And he came to the second and said likewise. And he answered and said, `I go, sir,' and went not.

31.verse: Which of those two did the will of his father?" They said unto Him, "The first." Jesus said unto them, "Verily I say unto you, that the publicans and the harlots go into the Kingdom of God before you.

32.verse: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not; but the publicans and harlots believed him. And ye, when ye had seen it, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.

33.verse: "Hear another parable: There was a certain householder who planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and dug a wine press in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen and went into a far country.

34.verse: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.

35.verse: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one and killed another and stoned another.

36.verse: Again, he sent other servants, more than the first; and they did unto them likewise.

37.verse: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, `They will reverence my son.'

38.verse: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, `This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.'

39.verse: And they caught him and cast him out of the vineyard and slew him.

40.verse: When therefore the lord of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?"

41.verse: They said unto Him, "He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, who shall render him the fruits in their seasons."

42.verse: Jesus said unto them, "Did ye never read in the Scriptures: `The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner. This is the Lord's doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?

43.verse: Therefore say I unto you, the Kingdom of God shall be taken from you and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.

44.verse: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder."

45.verse: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees had heard His parables, they perceived that He spoke of them.

46.verse: But when they sought to lay hands on Him, they feared the multitude, because they took Him for a prophet.

1.verse: And Jesus answered and spoke unto them again in parables and said,

2.verse: "The Kingdom of Heaven is like unto a certain king, who made a marriage for his son.

3.verse: And he sent forth his servants to call them that were bidden to the wedding, and they would not come.

4.verse: Again he sent forth other servants, saying, `Tell them that are bidden, "Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready. Come unto the marriage."'

5.verse: But they made light of it and went their ways, one to his farm, and another to his merchandise,

6.verse: and the remnant took his servants and treated them spitefully and slew them.

7.verse: But when the king heard thereof he was wroth, and he sent forth his armies and destroyed those murderers and burned up their city.

8.verse: Then said he to his servants, `The wedding is ready, but they that were bidden were not worthy.

9.verse: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.'

10.verse: So those servants went out into the highways, and gathered all together as many as they found, both bad and good, and the wedding was furnished with guests.

11.verse: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man who did not have on a wedding garment.

12.verse: And he said unto him, `Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment?' And he was speechless.

13.verse: Then said the king to the servants, `Bind him hand and foot and take him away, and cast him into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

14.verse: For many are called, but few are chosen."

15.verse: Then the Pharisees went and took counsel how they might entangle Him in His talk.

16.verse: And they sent out unto Him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, "Master, we know that thou art true and teachest the way of God in truth; neither carest thou for any man, for thou regardest not the person of men.

17.verse: Tell us therefore, what thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Caesar, or not?"

18.verse: But Jesus perceived their wickedness and said, "Why tempt ye Me, ye hypocrites?

19.verse: Show Me the tribute money." And they brought unto Him a penny.

20.verse: And He said unto them, "Whose is this image and superscription?"

21.verse: And they said unto Him, "Caesar's." Then said He unto them, "Render therefore unto Caesar the things which are Caesar's, and unto God the things that are God's."

22.verse: When they had heard these words, they marveled, and left Him and went their way.

23.verse: The same day the Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection, came to Him and asked Him,

24.verse: saying, "Master, Moses said, `If a man die, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife and raise up seed unto his brother.'

25.verse: Now there were with us seven brethren. And the first, when he had married a wife, died; and having no issue, he left his wife unto his brother.

26.verse: Likewise the second also, and the third, unto the seventh.

27.verse: And last of all, the woman died also.

28.verse: Therefore in the resurrection, whose wife shall she be of the seven? For they all had her."

29.verse: Jesus answered and said unto them, "Ye do err, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God.

30.verse: For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as the angels of God in Heaven.

31.verse: But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,

32.verse: `I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob'? God is not the God of the dead, but of the living."

33.verse: And when the multitude heard this, they were astonished at His doctrine.

34.verse: But when the Pharisees had heard that He had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.

35.verse: Then one of them, who was a lawyer, asked Him a question, tempting Him and saying,

36.verse: "Master, which is the great commandment in the law?"

37.verse: Jesus said unto him, "`Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.'

38.verse: This is the first and great commandment.

39.verse: And the second is like unto it: `Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.'

40.verse: On these two commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets."

41.verse: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

42.verse: saying, "What think ye of Christ? Whose Son is He?" They said unto Him, "The son of David."

43.verse: He said unto them, "How then doth David in the Spirit call Him `Lord,' saying,

44.verse: `The LORD said unto my Lord, "Sit Thou on My right hand until I make Thine enemies Thy footstool"'?

45.verse: If David then call Him `Lord,' how is He his son?"

46.verse: And no man was able to answer Him a word; neither dared any man from that day forth ask Him any more questions.

1.verse: Then spoke Jesus to the multitude and to His disciples,

2.verse: saying, "The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat.

3.verse: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe, that observe and do; but do ye not according to their works; for they say, and do not.

4.verse: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay them on men's shoulders, but they themselves will not move them with one of their fingers.

5.verse: But all their works they do to be seen by men. They make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,

6.verse: and love the uppermost places at feasts and the chief seats in the synagogues,

7.verse: and greetings in the markets, and to be called by men, `Rabbi, Rabbi.'

8.verse: But be not ye called `Rabbi,' for One is your Master, even Christ; and all ye are brethren.

9.verse: "And call no man your father upon earth, for One is your Father, who is in Heaven.

10.verse: Neither be ye called masters, for One is your Master, even Christ.

11.verse: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.

12.verse: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased, and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.

13.verse: "But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye shut up the Kingdom of Heaven against men, for ye neither go in yourselves, neither suffer ye them that are entering to go in.

14.verse: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye devour widows' houses, and for a pretense make long prayers; therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.

15.verse: "Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.

16.verse: "Woe unto you, ye blind guides, who say, `Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is obligated.'

17.verse: Ye fools and blind! For which is greater, the gold, or the temple that sanctifieth the gold?

18.verse: And ye say, `Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is liable.'

19.verse: Ye fools and blind! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifieth the gift?

20.verse: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it and by all things thereon.

21.verse: And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it and by Him that dwelleth therein.

22.verse: And he that shall swear by Heaven, sweareth by the throne of God and by Him that sitteth thereon.

23.verse: "Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier matters of the law: judgment, mercy, and faith. These ought ye to have done and not to leave the other undone.

24.verse: Ye blind guides, who strain out a gnat and swallow a camel!

25.verse: "Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.

26.verse: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.

27.verse: "Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For ye are like unto whited sepulchers, which indeed appear beautiful outwardly, but are within full of dead men's bones and of all uncleanness.

28.verse: Even so, ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

29.verse: "Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because ye build the tombs of the prophets and garnish the sepulchers of the righteous,

30.verse: and say, `If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.'

31.verse: Therefore ye are witnesses against yourselves, that ye are the children of them that killed the prophets.

32.verse: Fill ye up, then, the measure of your fathers.

33.verse: "Ye serpents, ye generation of vipers! How can ye escape the damnation of hell?

34.verse: Therefore, behold, I send unto you prophets and wise men and scribes, and some of them ye shall kill and crucify, and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues and persecute them from city to city,

35.verse: that upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zechariah, son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

36.verse: Verily I say unto you, all these things shall come upon this generation.

37.verse: "O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, thou that killest the prophets and stonest them that are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and ye would not!

38.verse: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.

39.verse: For I say unto you, ye shall not see Me henceforth till ye shall say, `Blessed is He that cometh in the name of the Lord!'"

1.verse: And Jesus went out and departed from the temple, and His disciples came to Him to show Him the buildings of the temple.

2.verse: And Jesus said unto them, "See ye not all these things? Verily I say unto you, there shall not be left here one stone upon another that shall not be thrown down."

3.verse: And as He sat upon the Mount of Olives, the disciples came unto Him privately, saying, "Tell us, when shall these things be? And what shall be the sign of Thy coming and of the end of the world?"

4.verse: And Jesus answered and said unto them, "Take heed that no man deceive you;

5.verse: for many shall come in My name, saying, `I am Christ,' and shall deceive many.

6.verse: And ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that ye be not troubled, for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.

7.verse: For nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and there shall be famines and pestilences and earthquakes in divers places.

8.verse: All these are the beginning of sorrows.

9.verse: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted and shall kill you, and ye shall be hated by all nations for My name's sake.

10.verse: And then shall many lose faith and shall betray one another and shall hate one another.

11.verse: And many false prophets shall rise and shall deceive many.

12.verse: And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.

13.verse: But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

14.verse: And this Gospel of the Kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations, and then shall the end come.

15.verse: "When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (whoso readeth, let him understand),

16.verse: then let them that be in Judea flee unto the mountains.

17.verse: Let him that is on the housetop not come down to take anything out of his house;

18.verse: neither let him that is in the field return back to take his clothes.

19.verse: And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

20.verse: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the Sabbath day.

21.verse: For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be.

22.verse: And unless those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved; but for the elect's sake, those days shall be shortened.

23.verse: Then if any man shall say unto you, `Lo, here is Christ,' or `there,' believe it not.

24.verse: For there shall arise false christs and false prophets and shall show great signs and wonders, insomuch that, if it were possible, they shall deceive the very elect.

25.verse: Behold, I have told you before.

26.verse: Therefore, if they shall say unto you, `Behold, He is in the desert!' go not forth; or `Behold, He is in the secret chambers!' believe it not.

27.verse: For as the lightning cometh out of the east and shineth even unto the west, so shall also the coming of the Son of Man be.

28.verse: For wheresoever the carcass is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

29.verse: "Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken,

30.verse: and then shall appear the sign of the Son of Man in heaven. And then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of Man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and with great glory.

31.verse: And He shall send His angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together His elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

32.verse: "Now learn a parable of the fig tree: When his branch is yet tender and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is nigh.

33.verse: So likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors.

34.verse: Verily I say unto you, this generation shall not pass till all these things be fulfilled.

35.verse: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but My Words shall not pass away.

36.verse: But of that day and hour, knoweth no man, no, not the angels of Heaven, but My Father only.

37.verse: But as the days of Noah were, so shall also the coming of the Son of Man be.

38.verse: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ark

39.verse: and knew not until the flood came and took them all away, so shall also the coming of the Son of Man be.

40.verse: Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken and the other left.

41.verse: Two women shall be grinding at the mill; the one shall be taken and the other left.

42.verse: "Watch therefore, for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.

43.verse: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have watched and would not have suffered his house to be broken into.

44.verse: Therefore be ye also ready, for in such an hour as ye think not, the Son of Man cometh.

45.verse: "Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?

46.verse: Blessed is that servant whom his lord, when he cometh, shall find so doing.

47.verse: Verily I say unto you, that he shall make him ruler over all his goods.

48.verse: But if that evil servant shall say in his heart, `My lord delayeth his coming,'

49.verse: and shall begin to smite his fellow servants and to eat and drink with the drunken,

50.verse: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him, and in an hour that he is not aware of,

51.verse: and shall cut him asunder and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

1.verse: "Then shall the Kingdom of Heaven be likened unto ten virgins, who took their lamps and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

2.verse: And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

3.verse: They that were foolish took their lamps and took no oil with them,

4.verse: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

5.verse: While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

6.verse: And at midnight there was a cry made: `Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.'

7.verse: Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps.

8.verse: And the foolish said unto the wise, `Give us of your oil, for our lamps are gone out.'

9.verse: But the wise answered, saying, `Not so, lest there be not enough for us and you; but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.'

10.verse: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came, and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage, and the door was shut.

11.verse: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, `Lord, lord, open to us!'

12.verse: But he answered and said, `Verily I say unto you, I know you not.'

13.verse: Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of Man cometh.

14.verse: "For the Kingdom of Heaven is as a man traveling into a far country, who called his own servants and delivered unto them his goods.

15.verse: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one, to every man according to his several ability, and straightway tookhis journey.

16.verse: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and made them another five talents.

17.verse: And likewise he that had received two, he also gained another two.

18.verse: But he that had received one went and dug in the earth and hid his lord's money.

19.verse: After a long time the lord of those servants came and reckoned with them.

20.verse: And so he that had received five talents came and brought the other five talents, saying, `Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents. Behold, I have gained beside them five talents more.'

21.verse: His lord said unto him, `Well done, thou good and faithful servant. Thou hast been faithful over a few things; I will make thee ruler over many things. Enter thou into the joy of thy lord.'

22.verse: "He also that had received two talents came and said, `Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents; behold, I have gained two other talents beside them.'

23.verse: His lord said unto him, `Well done, good and faithful servant. Thou hast been faithful over a few things; I will make thee ruler over many things. Enter thou into the joy of thy lord.'

24.verse: "Then he that had received the one talent came and said, `Lord, I knew thee, that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strewed.

25.verse: And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth. Lo, there thou hast what is thine.'

26.verse: His lord answered and said unto him, `Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strewed.

27.verse: Thou ought therefore to have placed my money with the exchangers, and then at my coming I should have received mine own with interest.

28.verse: Take therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him that hath ten talents.

29.verse: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance; but from him that hath not, shall be taken away even that which he hath.

30.verse: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

31.verse: "When the Son of Man shall come in His glory and all the holy angels with Him, then shall He sit upon the throne of His glory.

32.verse: And before Him shall be gathered all nations, and He shall separate them one from another as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats.

33.verse: And He shall set the sheep on His right hand, but the goats on the left.

34.verse: Then shall the King say unto them on His right hand, `Come, ye blessed of My Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world.

35.verse: For I hungered, and ye gave Me meat; I was thirsty, and ye gave Me drink; I was a stranger, and ye took Me in;

36.verse: naked, and ye clothed Me; I was sick, and ye visited Me; I was in prison, and ye came unto Me.'

37.verse: Then shall the righteous answer Him, saying, `Lord, when saw we Thee hungering and fed Thee, or thirsty and gave Thee drink?

38.verse: When saw we Thee a stranger and took Thee in, or naked and clothed Thee?

39.verse: Or when saw we Thee sick, or in prison, and came unto Thee?'

40.verse: And the King shall answer and say unto them, `Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these My brethren, ye have done it unto Me.'

41.verse: "Then shall He say also unto them on the left hand, `Depart from Me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire prepared for the devil and his angels.

42.verse: For I hungered, and ye gave Me no meat; I was thirsty, and ye gave Me no drink;

43.verse: I was a stranger, and ye took Me not in; naked, and ye clothed Me not; sick and in prison, and ye visited Me not.'

44.verse: Then shall they also answer Him, saying, `Lord, when saw we Thee hungering or athirst or a stranger, or naked or sick or in prison, and did not minister unto Thee?'

45.verse: Then shall He answer them, saying, `Verily I say unto you, inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to Me.'

46.verse: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment, but the righteous into life eternal."

1.verse: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, He said unto His disciples,

2.verse: "Ye know that after two days is the Feast of the Passover, and the Son of Man is betrayed to be crucified."

3.verse: Then the chief priests and the scribes and the elders of the people assembled together unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,

4.verse: and consulted that they might take Jesus by stealth and kill Him.

5.verse: But they said, "Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people."

6.verse: Now when Jesus was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,

7.verse: there came unto Him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on His head as He sat at meat.

8.verse: But when His disciples saw it, they were indignant, saying, "To what purpose is this waste?

9.verse: For this ointment might have been sold for much and given to the poor."

10.verse: When Jesus perceived this, He said unto them, "Why trouble ye the woman? For she hath wrought a good work upon Me.

11.verse: For ye have the poor always with you, but Me ye have not always.

12.verse: For in that she hath poured this ointment on My body, she did it for My burial.

13.verse: Verily I say unto you, wheresoever this Gospel shall be preached in the whole world, there shall also this, which this woman hath done, be told as a memorial of her."

14.verse: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests

15.verse: and said unto them, "What will ye give me if I will deliver Him unto you?" And they covenanted with him for thirty pieces of silver.

16.verse: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray Him.

17.verse: Now on the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying unto Him, "Where wilt Thou that we prepare for Thee to eat the Passover?"

18.verse: And He said, "Go into the city to a certain man and say unto him, `The Master saith, "My time is at hand; I will keep the Passover at thy house with My disciples."'"

19.verse: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them, and they made ready the Passover.

20.verse: Now when the evening had come, He sat down with the twelve.

21.verse: And as they ate, He said, "Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray Me."

22.verse: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto Him, "Lord, is it I?"

23.verse: And He answered and said, "He that dippeth his hand with Me in the dish, the same shall betray Me.

24.verse: The Son of Man goeth as it is written of Him, but woe unto that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It had been good for that man if he had not been born."

25.verse: Then Judas, who betrayed Him, answered and said, "Master, is it I?" He said unto him, "Thou hast said."

26.verse: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread and blessed it and broke it, and gave it to the disciples and said, "Take, eat; this is My body."

27.verse: And He took the cup and gave thanks, and gave it to them, saying, "Drink ye all of it;

28.verse: for this is My blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.

29.verse: But I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new with you in My Father's Kingdom."

30.verse: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out unto the Mount of Olives.

31.verse: Then Jesus said unto them, "All ye shall be offended because of Me this night; for it is written: `I will smite the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad.'

32.verse: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee."

33.verse: Peter answered and said unto Him, "Though all men shall be offended because of Thee, yet I will never be offended."

34.verse: Jesus said unto him, "Verily I say unto thee, that this night before the cock crow, thou shalt deny Me thrice."

35.verse: Peter said unto Him, "Though I should die with Thee, yet will I not deny Thee." Likewise also said all the disciples.

36.verse: Then Jesus came with them unto a place called Gethsemane, and said unto the disciples, "Sit ye here while I go and pray yonder."

37.verse: And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.

38.verse: Then He said unto them, "My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death; tarry ye here and watch with Me."

39.verse: And He went a little farther, and fell on His face and prayed, saying, "O My Father, if it be possible, let this cup pass from Me; nevertheless, not as I will, but as Thou wilt."

40.verse: And He came unto the disciples and found them asleep, and said unto Peter, "What, could ye not watch with Me one hour?

41.verse: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak."

42.verse: He went away again the second time and prayed, saying, "O My Father, if this cup may not pass away from Me, unless I drink it, Thy will be done."

43.verse: And He came and found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy.

44.verse: And He left them and went away again, and prayed a third time, saying the same words.

45.verse: Then came He to His disciples and said unto them, "Sleep on now, and take your rest. Behold, the hour is at hand, and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.

46.verse: Rise, let us be going. Behold, he is at hand that doth betray Me."

47.verse: And while He yet spoke, lo, Judas, one of the twelve came, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

48.verse: Now he that betrayed Him gave them a sign, saying, "Whomsoever I shall kiss, that same is He; hold Him fast."

49.verse: And forthwith he came to Jesus and said, "Hail, Master!" and kissed Him.

50.verse: And Jesus said unto him, "Friend, why art thou come?" Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and took Him.

51.verse: And behold, one of those who was with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and struck a servant of the high priest and smote off his ear.

52.verse: Then said Jesus unto him, "Put up again thy sword into his place, for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.

53.verse: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to My Father, and He shall at once give Me more than twelve legions of angels?

54.verse: But how then shall the Scriptures be fulfilled, that thus it must be?"

55.verse: In that same hour Jesus said to the multitudes, "Are ye come out as against a thief, with swords and staves to take Me? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye laid no hold on Me.

56.verse: But all this was done that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled." Then all the disciples forsook Him and fled.

57.verse: And those who had laid hold on Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.

58.verse: But Peter followed Him afar off unto the high priest's palace, and went in and sat with the servants to see the end.

59.verse: Now the chief priests and elders and all the council sought false witness against Jesus to put Him to death,

60.verse: but found none. Yea, though many false witnesses came, yet found they none. At the last came two false witnesses,

61.verse: and said, "This fellow said, `I am able to destroy the temple of God and to build it in three days.'"

62.verse: And the high priest arose and said unto Him, "Answerest thou nothing? What is it which these witnesses say against thee?"

63.verse: But Jesus held His peace. And the high priest answered and said unto Him, "I adjure thee by the living God that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God."

64.verse: Jesus said unto him, "Thou hast said; nevertheless I say unto you, hereafter shall ye see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming in the clouds of heaven."

65.verse: Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, "He hath spoken blasphemy! What further need have we of witnesses? Behold, now ye have heard his blasphemy!

66.verse: What think ye?" They answered and said, "He is deserving of death!"

67.verse: Then they spit in His face and buffeted Him, and others smote Him with the palms of their hands,

68.verse: saying, "Prophesy unto us, thou Christ! Who is he that smote thee?"

69.verse: Now Peter sat outside in the palace, and a damsel came unto him, saying, "Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee."

70.verse: But he denied it before them all, saying, "I know not what thou sayest."

71.verse: And when he had gone out onto the porch, another maid saw him and said unto those who were there, "This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth."

72.verse: And again he denied with an oath, "I do not know the man!"

73.verse: And after a while came unto him those who stood by, and said to Peter, "Surely thou also art one of them, for thy speech betrayeth thee."

74.verse: Then he began to curse and to swear, saying, "I know not the man!" And immediately the cock crowed.

75.verse: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, when He said unto him, "Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny Me thrice." And he went out and wept bitterly.

1.verse: When the morning had come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put Him to death.

2.verse: And when they had bound Him, they led Him away and delivered Him to Pontius Pilate, the governor.

3.verse: Then Judas, who had betrayed Him, when he saw that He was condemned, repented and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

4.verse: saying, "I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood." And they said, "What is that to us? See thou to that!"

5.verse: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple and departed, and went and hanged himself.

6.verse: And the chief priests took the silver pieces and said, "It is not lawful to put them into the treasury, because it is the price of blood."

7.verse: And they took counsel and bought with them the potter's field, to bury strangers in.

8.verse: Therefore that field was called the Field of Blood unto this day.

9.verse: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, "And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of Him that was valued, whom they the children of Israel did value,

10.verse: and gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me."

11.verse: And Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked Him, saying, "Art thou the King of the Jews?" And Jesus said unto him, "Thou sayest."

12.verse: And when He was accused by the chief priests and elders, He answered nothing.

13.verse: Then said Pilate unto Him, "Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?"

14.verse: And He answered him never a word, insomuch that the governor marveled greatly.

15.verse: Now at that feast, the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.

16.verse: And they had then a notable prisoner called Barabbas.

17.verse: Therefore when they were gathered together, Pilate said unto them, "Whom will ye that I release unto you: Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ?"

18.verse: For he knew that for envy they had delivered Him.

19.verse: When he had sat down on the judgment seat, his wife sent unto him, saying, "Have thou nothing to do with that just man; for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him."

20.verse: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask for Barabbas and destroy Jesus.

21.verse: The governor answered and said unto them, "Which of the two will ye that I release unto you?" They said, "Barabbas!"

22.verse: Pilate said unto them, "What shall I do then with Jesus, who is called Christ?" They all said unto him, "Let him be crucified!"

23.verse: And the governor said, "Why, what evil hath he done?" But they cried out the more, saying, "Let him be crucified!"

24.verse: When Pilate saw that he could not prevail, but rather that a tumult was beginning, he took water and washed his hands before the multitude, saying, "I am innocent of the blood of this just person. See ye to it."

25.verse: Then answered all the people and said, "His blood be on us, and on our children!"

26.verse: Then released he Barabbas unto them; and when he had scourged Jesus, he delivered Him to be crucified.

27.verse: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto Him the whole detachment of soldiers.

28.verse: And they stripped Him and put on Him a scarlet robe.

29.verse: And when they had plaited a crown of thorns, they put it upon His head and a reed in His right hand, and they bowed their knees before Him and mocked Him, saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!"

30.verse: And they spat upon Him, and took the reed and smote Him on the head.

31.verse: And after they had mocked Him, they took the robe off from Him and put His own raiment on Him, and led Him away to crucify Him.

32.verse: And as they came out, they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name; him they compelled to bear His cross.

33.verse: And when they had come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a Place of a Skull,

34.verse: they gave Him vinegar to drink mingled with gall. And when He had tasted thereof, He would not drink.

35.verse: And they crucified Him and parted His garments, casting lots, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet: "They parted My garments among them, and upon My vesture did they cast lots."

36.verse: And sitting down, they watched Him there,

37.verse: and set up over His head His accusation, written: THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

38.verse: Then were there two thieves crucified with Him, one on the right hand and another on the left.

39.verse: And those who passed by reviled Him, wagging their heads

40.verse: and saying, "Thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days, save thyself! If thou be the Son of God, come down from the cross!"

41.verse: Likewise also the chief priests mocking Him, with the scribes and elders said,

42.verse: "He saved others; himself he cannot save. If he be the King of Israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe him.

43.verse: He trusted in God; let Him deliver him now, if He will have him. For he said, `I am the Son of God.'"

44.verse: The thieves also, who were crucified with Him, cast the same in His teeth.

45.verse: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

46.verse: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, "Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?" that is to say, "My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me?"

47.verse: Some of those who stood there, when they heard that, said, "This man calleth for Elijah."

48.verse: And straightway one of them ran and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed and gave Him to drink.

49.verse: The rest said, "Let be; let us see whether Elijah will come to save him."

50.verse: Jesus, when He had cried out again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.

51.verse: And behold, the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom, and the earth quaked and the rocks rent.

52.verse: And the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints who slept arose,

53.verse: and came out of the graves after His resurrection, and went into the Holy City and appeared unto many.

54.verse: Now when the centurion, and those who were with him watching Jesus, saw the earthquake and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, "Truly, this was the Son of God!"

55.verse: And many women were there beholding afar off, who followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto Him,

56.verse: among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee's children.

57.verse: When the evening had come, there came a rich man of Arimathea named Joseph, who himself also was Jesus' disciple.

58.verse: He went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

59.verse: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth

60.verse: and laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock. And he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulcher and departed.

61.verse: And Mary Magdalene was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the sepulcher.

62.verse: Now the next day, that following the Day of the Preparation, the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate,

63.verse: saying, "Sir, we remember that that deceiver said while he was yet alive, `After three days I will rise again.'

64.verse: Command therefore that the sepulcher be made secure until the third day, lest his disciples come by night and steal him away, and say unto the people, `He is risen from the dead,' so that the last error shall be worse than the first."

65.verse: Pilate said unto them, "Ye have a watch. Go your way, make it as secure as ye can."

66.verse: So they went and made the sepulcher secure, sealing the stone and setting up a watch.

1.verse: At the end of the Sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week, came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulcher.

2.verse: And behold, there was a great earthquake, for the angel of the Lord descended from Heaven, and came and rolled back the stone from the door, and sat upon it.

3.verse: His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow.

4.verse: And for fear of him the guards shook and became as dead men.

5.verse: And the angel answered and said unto the women, "Fear ye not, for I know that ye seek Jesus, who was crucified.

6.verse: He is not here, for He is risen, as He said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.

7.verse: And go quickly and tell His disciples that He is risen from the dead, and behold, He goeth before you into Galilee. There shall ye see Him. Lo, I have told you."

8.verse: And they departed quickly from the sepulcher with fear and great joy, and ran to bring His disciples word.

9.verse: And as they went to tell His disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, "All hail." And they came, and held Him by the feet, and worshiped Him.

10.verse: Then said Jesus unto them, "Be not afraid. Go tell My brethren to go into Galilee, and there shall they see Me."

11.verse: Now when they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city and reported unto the chief priests all the things that were done.

12.verse: And when they were assembled with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave a large sum of money unto the soldiers,

13.verse: saying, "Say ye, `His disciples came by night and stole him away while we slept.'

14.verse: And if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him and secure you."

15.verse: So they took the money, and did as they were taught; and this account is commonly reported among the Jews until this day.

16.verse: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee onto a mountain where Jesus had appointed them.

17.verse: And when they saw Him, they worshiped Him; but some doubted.

18.verse: And Jesus came and spoke unto them, saying, "All power is given unto Me in Heaven and on earth.

19.verse: Go ye therefore and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost,

20.verse: teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you. And lo, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world." Amen.
